sen.j: 土御門 久脩（つちみかど ひさなが、永禄3年（1560年） - 寛永2年1月18日 (旧暦)（1625年2月24日））は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代の公卿・陰陽家。
sen.e: Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO (1560-February 24, 1625) was Kugyo (the top court official) and Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.

Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO (1560-February 24, 1625) was Kugyo (top court official) and Inyoka (a practitioner of the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the Edo Period.

Hisanaga TSUCHIMIKADO (1560-February 24, 1625) was Kugyo (top court official) and Inyoka (a practitioner of the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period.

sen.j: 堂上家（家格は半家 (公家)・阿倍氏）である、土御門家の31代目当主。
sen.e: He was the thirty-first family head of the Tsuchimikado family which was Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) (the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the ABE clan.)

He was the thirty-first family head of the TSUCHIMIKADO family which was Tosho-ke, or the hereditary lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks, of which the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the ABE clan.

He was the thirty-first family head of the TSUCHIMIKADO family which was Tosho-ke, or the hereditary lineage of court nobles occupying relatively high ranks, of which the social standing was hange (kuge), kuge of lower rank and the ABE clan.

sen.j: 陰陽頭（従三位・非参議）・土御門有脩の子。
sen.e: He was the child of Ariyasu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) (Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), non-Councilor.)
He was the child of Ariyasu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of the Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and non-councilor.
He was the child of Ariyasu TSUCHIMIKADO, Onmyo no kami (Director of the Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and non-councilor.

sen.j: 実子に左兵衛督（従二位・非参議）・土御門泰重、民部卿・倉橋泰吉（倉橋家初代）、五辻斉仲（非参議・五辻之仲の養子）らがいる。
sen.e: His biological children included Yasushige TSUCHIMIKADO, Sahyoe no kami (Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards) (Junii (Junior Second Rank), non-Councilor), Yasuyoshi KURAHASHI (the ancestor of the Kurahashi family), Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Narinaka ITSUTSUJI (the adopted child of Korenaka ITSUTSUJI, non-Councilor).

His biological children included Yasushige TSUCHIMIKADO, Sahyoe no kami (Captain of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards), Junii (Junior Second Rank and non-councilor), Yasuyoshi KURAHASHI (the ancestor of the Kurahashi family), Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Narinaka ITSUTSUJI (the adopted child of Korenaka ITSUTSUJI, non-councilor).

His biological children included Yasushige TSUCHIMIKADO, Sahyoe no kami (Captain of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards), Junii (Junior Second Rank and non-councilor), Yasuyoshi KURAHASHI (the ancestor of the Kurahashi family), Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Narinaka ITSUTSUJI (the adopted child of Korenaka ITSUTSUJI, non-councilor).

sen.j: 官途は、従三位（非参議）・陰陽頭。
sen.e: His kanto (government service) was Jusanmi (non-Councilor), Onmyo no kami.
His government service was as Jusanmi (non-councilor), Onmyo no kami.
His government service was as Jusanmi (non-councilor), Onmyo no kami.
